comments.commentBody: Exactly! The only thing that Uber should have to do is to offshore its before-tax profit.

I have consistently enjoyed more convenience and a better experience using Uber or Lyft in cities like LA, Phoenix, San Diego, compared to cabs. The traditional cab companies cannot be allowed to monopolize the market and stifle innovation. But "sharing economy" companies also cannot be allowed to bypass the law and operate rogue companies, some of which provide a platform for citizens to violate existing laws or local ordinances - Airbnb and rover.com, as examples.

But Uber's vile treatment of its employees and "independent contractors," on top of the disregard to following laws, is what sent me over the edge.

Deleted my Uber account last week. Vote with your wallets.

"Contingent Collision and Comprehensive¹
As long as a rideshare driver has personal collision or comprehensive insurance,

this policy covers physical damage that occurs during a trip and is subject to a deductible."

That's big loophole, not to mention that this info is on a page _advertising for drivers_. The info is not meant for _passengers_.

The media just can't get over it.  A platform that has beaten their union buddies in the 'big-cab' industry, at their own game.   Keep trying to undermine Uber and Lyft, we're all numb to it, and laughing as we pay our competitive fares in better, newer vehicles with friendlier, better drivers.

Dear Carlo:
I disagree with everything you stated. The Unions are the only thing which saves the Lumpen Proles from becoming working class mendicants. You're glee in overthrowing the working class speaks volumes, of the same sarcastic and exclusionary tone that your idiot in chief occupant in the Oval Office does, another great Union buster such as yourself.

The one thing I do concur with your rant of jubilation is thus: I do believe indeed of your stated numbness of the brain. As for laughing as you pay, well, I must say the giggles you refer to must be coming from the intense heat emanating in the Valley of the Sun, a desolate parched piece of desert land that would have remained so were it not for the invention of a man from New York, Mr. Carrier, who made living in such climes bearable. Please put on a load of sun block and wear a hat otherwise you may suffer the horrible fate of your Senator McCain, a brave man who unfortunately has spent too much time out in the sun. Bon Chance, old sport.

DD
Manhattan

Why is this different from your neighbor using a "fuzz buster"? Apps abound showing where cops have set up speed traps. Trucker's signal each other on the road when there is a speed trap. People flash their lights when cops are giving out speeding tickets.

People like Uber and they've held the taxi companies feet to the fire to provide better service, pick up folks in poor neighborhoods etc. I think this is a tempest in a teapot.

GreyBall is no worse than using a radar detector or Waze police reports to circumvent the "tax collectors in blue." Uber delivers plenty of customers to my business. Since they haven't been financially raped by a taxi, they have more money to spend with me.

If cities are short of cash, they might try raising taxes on their wealthiest residents. I'm sick of regressive policies that force those with the least to support the infrastructure used by the wealthy. If a city's main motivation in enforcement is to stick it to people trying to make a living, I consider it more than fair to use any tools available to foil those activities.

The core issue that has made Uber successful is that taxis in many cities have been cartels run by very ruthless people often in collusion or at least with the benign neglect of city officials. For a very long time. (City governments in general are notorious for graft and related muck.)  As such Uber's dirty tactics force cities to clean up their act before they can really attack Uber.  Once again an opportunity was seen by some entrepreneurial people because something was no longer working properly. However Uber does have to learn to play by rules as well.  And citizens before voting for Prime Ministers and Presidents need to demand a cleaning up of their own back yards. If they don't. how will it ever change ?
A notably substance-free response from Luke.

"Collectively, Uber drivers have a larger investment in Uber than all VC money combined. "

Umm, no. Just not true.
Go Uber! The government wants to say Uber was breaking the law by not allowing the government to entrap them; I say more companies should do this. The government overreaches way too often.

Dear Mr. J. Smith:
We need more regulations not less when it comes to reining in these billionaire CEO's who are making enormous profits from the toil and exploitation of the masses.

When I hear you rattle on, saying companies should revolt against the government, I think of all the others who are as ignorant as yourself, folks who want the rich to get richer with consideration whatsoever of passing their gargantuan profits down to the workers who actually do the heavy lifting.

Your priorities as well as your head are placed in a most awkward position. You should remove both from that orifice and take a good look around. The calamity they create is has become the bane of their existence, old sport.

DD
Manhattan

All the talk about unwanted pregnancy is always focused on the woman. But as far as I know there has only been one immaculate conception and not everyone believes in that one. The onus is always n the woman because a man can't get pregnant. Why don't Pro Lifers place some focus on the men who impregnate these women, some of whom I call serial impregnaters. How about some laws to FORCE them to take responsibility for the children they have helped to create. Throw them in jail if they don't comply. You bet they would be more careful about using a condom if their lives could be turned upside down. If men could learn to control their urges, as the always tell the women to do, abortion would be less of an issue.

Mr. Bruni I am much more concerned with the diet and eating habits of the mothers and children that will be separated at the border and put in separated detention centers because the are refugees. An overfed male can eat what he wants but those mothers and children just may not make because of this horrendous policy of separating mothers and children. Let Trump eat well done steak with ketchup as long as the refugees can stay together as a family.
Next stop: The Twilight Zone < that music playing in the background >
I'm now beginning to feel we have George Costanza as our President.
Yeah, except George's ego wasn't so bigly. George knew humility.

You're probably right, but for being polite I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  My appeal is really for their constituents to put enough pressure on them so to make it in their self-interest to do the right thing.  I really do share your skepticism about Turtle Boy and Eddie Munster, but I try to be a mensch about it.   :-)
Applying psychoanalytic interpretation to the president's words, the likely bad or sick person is liikely not the former president.

I hope there is a rational basis for Trump to get fuming to make the outrageous tweets this morning: Trump may realize that the noose is tightening or he has been briefed that someone close to him has been involved. If there is no rational basis for his tweets and if they were merely based on reading what Breitbart a.k.a. fake news published, it is scary to imagine what he could do in the next 47 months!
Don't insult grade school kids.
as a real form of protest, i urge all americans to purchase a pair of steel ball bearings, and roll them nervously in their palms during conversations w trump supporters
I wonder how many people understand that allusion to Capt. Queeg...
That are use multi- Syllabic words, scare them.
and ask about the strawberries

I think the DOJ most likely sanctioned and ordered the wiretapping.  The intelligence agencies were aware of the Russian involvement in hacking the DNC. The Trump campaign was in contact with the Russian Ambassador and Trump's comments and sudden fondness for Putin and Russia were suspect. Undoubtedly, President Obama was aware of the wiretapping.  There was probable cause to investigate and assure that no American citizen was colluding with a foreign enemy.  This is what we should expect from our government.  Now, the President of the United States has tweeted classified information for the world and our enemies to see and comment on.  Mr. Trump did nothing more than weaken our country today.

As reported by numerous news outlets, several intelligence agencies, in the US and in other countries, have confirmed there is ample evidence to confirm Russia's hacking/throwing  the US presidential election. The big question now is, how much was the Trump campaign involved in coordinating or collaborating with the Russians.

Mutiny on the Bounty was on cable the other night (coincidence?).

The behavior similarities between Humphrey Bogart's paranoid character and today's Trump are astonishing.
I suggest his election is evidence that it is already destabilized.
Trump should know better then to release the classified information concerning the wire tap of his offices.
It takes a Democratic majority, which is not coming soon nor may ever. The Republicans have a chance to permanently marginalize us. Think they will go for it?
